description: This file defines a FastAPI router for interacting with a Supabase database. It includes data models for filters and query responses, utility functions for validating configuration, applying filters, ordering, and pagination, and an endpoint (/query) to perform filtered, ordered, and paginated queries on a specified table in Supabase.

classes.name: SupabaseFilter
classes.description: Represents a filter criterion for querying Supabase, including the column, operator, and value.

classes.name: SupabaseQueryResponse
classes.description: Defines the structure of the response returned from a Supabase query, including items and metadata.

methods.name: None _validate_enabled_or_404()
methods.description: Checks if Supabase is enabled and properly configured; raises HTTP 404 or 503 errors if not.

methods.name: Any _apply_filters(q: Any, filters: Optional[List[SupabaseFilter]])
methods.description: Applies a list of filters to a Supabase query object based on filter specifications.

methods.name: Any _apply_order(q: Any, order_by: Optional[str], order_dir: Optional[str])
methods.description: Applies ordering parameters to a Supabase query.

methods.name: Tuple[Any,Dict[str,Any]] _apply_pagination(q: Any, limit: Optional[int], offset: Optional[int])
methods.description: Adds limit and offset to a Supabase query and returns associated metadata.

methods.name: SupabaseQueryResponse supabase_query( table: str = Query(..., description="Target table name"), order_by: Optional[str] = Query(None, description="Column to order by"), order_dir: Optional[Literal["asc", "desc"]] = Query("asc", description="Sort direction"), limit: Optional[int] = Query(50, ge=1, le=1000, description="Max rows to return"), offset: Optional[int] = Query(0, ge=0, description="Number of rows to skip"), filters: Optional[List[SupabaseFilter]] = Query( default=None, description="Optional list of filters. In interactive docs, click 'Add item' to supply filters.", ), )
methods.description: FastAPI endpoint that performs a filtered, ordered, and paginated query against a specified Supabase table.

ctags.name: _apply_order
ctags.pattern: /^def _apply_order(q: Any, order_by: Optional[str], order_dir: Optional[str]) -> Any:$/

ctags.name: _apply_pagination
ctags.pattern: /^def _apply_pagination(q: Any, limit: Optional[int], offset: Optional[int]) -> Tuple[Any, Dict[st/

ctags.name: column
ctags.pattern: /^    column: str = Field(..., description="Column name to filter on")$/

ctags.name: items
ctags.pattern: /^    items: List[Dict[str, Any]] = Field(default_factory=list, description="Result rows")$/

ctags.name: supabase_query
ctags.signature: ( table: str = Query(..., description="Target table name"), order_by: Optional[str] = Query(None, description="Column to order by"), order_dir: Optional[Literal["asc", "desc"]] = Query("asc", description="Sort direction"), limit: Optional[int] = Query(50, ge=1, le=1000, description="Max rows to return"), offset: Optional[int] = Query(0, ge=0, description="Number of rows to skip"), filters: Optional[List[SupabaseFilter]] = Query( default=None, description="Optional list of filters. In interactive docs, click 'Add item' to supply filters.", ), )

ctags.name: value
ctags.pattern: /^    value: Any = Field(..., description="Value to compare against")$/
